question.qText: Look at the poses of the man and his wife. Their poses signify all of the following EXCEPT:

aBtn.aText: the two figures together create the pyramidal shape favored by Italian Renaissance artists
that they are partners in science and that they work closely together
the artist admires Madame Lavoisier more than her husband
the Lavoisiers were a loving couple who admired each other’s abilities and talents
Lavoisier values her scientific knowledge and takes her opinions into consideration when writing his treatises

question.qText: The beam of light illuminating the couple probably signifies which of the following?

aBtn.aText: It has no meaning other than that the artist felt it visually complemented his composition.
The light symbolizes the ‘enlightenment’ that has come with the Scientific Revolution and his subjects’ scientific knowledge.
The light emphasizes the artist’s concern with imbuing the scene with theatrical drama.

question.qText: The artist’s point of view can be best characterized by which statement?

aBtn.aText: Because it was a commission, David made the couple look attractive and accomplished so that they would like the portrait.
As a Neoclassical artist, David was interested in conveying positive images of the Scientific Revolution.
As an Enlightenment artist, David was most concerned with creating a painting that adhered to Neoclassical precepts.

question.qText: The artist’s point of view is most clearly reflected in which aspect of the painting?

aBtn.aText: The figures of Lavoisier and his wife
The realistic reflection on the flask at Lavoisier’s feet
